  "Broker Comment" : "CIVIL COMPLAINT NO. C82-2419; JURY TRIAL DEMAND; FILED 9/7/82; IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF OHIO, EASTERN DIVISION; ENTITLED [CUSTOMERS], VS. KIDDER, PEABODY & CO., INC. AND LASZLO B. TORZSOK, JR. THIS ACTION IS BEING COMMENCED PURSUANT TO SECTION 10 (B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT, 15 U.S.C. 78 AND PURSUANT TO TITLE IX OF THE ORGANIZED CRIME CONTROL ACT OF 1970, COMMONLY KNOWN AS THE RACKETEER INFLUENCED AND CORRUPT ORGANIZATIONS ACT, 18 U.S.C. SECTONS 1961-1968. PLAINTIFFS WERE NOVICES AT FINANCIAL INVESTMENT GOALS AND OBJECTIVES. PLAINTIFFS WERE FRAUDULENTLY INDUCED TO ENTRUST THE DEFENDANTS WITH THE PLAINTIFFS' STOCK AND IRA TRUST ACCOUNTS, SO THAT THE DEFENDANTS COULD GENERATE EXCESSIVE COMMISSIONS AND EARNINGS. DEFENDANT TORZSOK, WHILE UNDER THE CONTROL OF KIDDER PEABODY, KNOWINGLY AND FRAUDULENTLY MISREPRESENTED FACTS TO THE PLAINTIFF, UPON WHICH THEY RELIED FOR ENTRUSTING THE DEFENDANTS WITH THE PLAINTIFFS' STOCK AND TRUST ACCOUNTS. THE PLAINTIFFS RELIED ON THE REPRESENTATIONS MADE BY THE DEFENDANTS AND WERE THEREBY INDUCED TO ENTRUST THE DEFENDANTS WITH FULL AND COMPLETE DISCRETION AND CONTROL OVER THE PLAINTIFFS' STOCK AND TRUST ACCOUNTS AND THUS DEFENDANTS ASSUMED A FIDUCIARY DUTY TO PLAINTIFFS. AND WHILE IN THIS FIDUCIARY POSITION DEFENDANTS CAUSED THE PLAINTIFFS' $26,000.00 INVESTMENT TO BE INVOLVED IN EXCESS OF $300,000 OF TRANSACTIONS. UPON GAINING CONTROL OF THE PLAINTIFFS' ACCOUNTS, DEFENDANTS CAUSED THEM TO BE EXCESSSIVELY TRADED, \"CHURNED\", IN ORDER TO GENERATE COMMISSIONS AND EARNINGS TO THE DETRIMENT OF THE PLAINTIFFS; THAT MOST TRANSACTIONS WERE BUYS AND SELLS OCCURING WITHIN NINETY DAYS OF ORIGINAL PURCHASE WITH LITTLE OR NO GAIN OR LOSS BUT FOR COMMISSIONS. DEFENDANTS FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY WAS THE DIRECT AND PROXIMATE CAUSE OF DAMAGES SUSTAINED BY THE PLAINTIFFS IN EXCESS OF $30"
}
